meanings.definition: To force something into a small space
meanings.sent1: She was cramming her clothes into the tiny suitcase.
meanings.sent2: The kids were cramming their toys into the box.
meanings.sent3: He tried cramming the oversized pillow into the small pillowcase.
meanings.sent4: The chef was cramming all the ingredients into the small pot.
meanings.sent5: The students were cramming their books into the locker, struggling to close the door.

meanings.definition: To study intensively in a short period of time
meanings.sent1: Sarah was cramming for her math test tonight.
meanings.sent2: Students often resort to cramming the night before exams.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cramming for the mouse-catching competition.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was cramming for the winter by collecting nuts.
meanings.sent5: The actor was cramming lines for the play, hoping to remember them all.
